page.title: 03EGLOSKERRY SCHOOL CONTINUED.
page.content: In 1958 the school of 26 children was still housed in the temporary two roomed wooden hut which had been put up nearly 40 years before. Water for wash basins and the servery was supplied by a hand worked semi rotary pump.Sanitation was of the bucket type.In 1959 mains water was put in. In 1960 a new school was built,a prefabricated Terrapin hut with 2 large classrooms and a kitchen. The playground was surfaced to make a large hard play area(30m.by 20m).In 1964 the nearby school at Tresmeer closed ,the children coming to Egloskerry. In 1967 main drainage was installed and an Elliot classroom was erected.The present school looks very much now as it did then with 50 children,2 teachers,and meals cooked on the premises.
